channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024060033
item.description:
Report X-2024060033

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The contents arrived in a different box than it was originally shipped in based on pictures in spidr and neither the current box nor the original one had any markings to indicate the contents were DOT regulated in any way. Initial inspection shows that the package was soaking wet on the side of the box. When interior inspection was done I found 6 plastic 28 oz bottles that all had loose caps and all spilled out a little. Estimated amount spilled is about 14oz.

item.title: Report X-2024051263
item.description:
Report X-2024051263

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the SFOR facility. The fiber board box contained two one gallon jugs and the caps on both jugs were loose spilling the contents. The jugs were packaged with bubble wrap for dunnage. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Manager discovered Hazmat box wet and placed inside a tote with absorbent, and then contacted Ops-admin-QA. Ops-Admin-QA came to collect the package. Wet hazmat package was placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent, and cleanup absorbent as well. Bag was then placed inside a hazmat tote, and then taken to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2024051249
item.description:
Report X-2024051249

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A GROUND TO HAWAII SERVICE PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED PRIOR TO FLIGHT TO HAWAII DUE TO A RATTLE SOUND HEARD COMING FROM THE BOX. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION WE CAN SEE A COVERED LIMITED QUANTITY MARK BLEEDING THROUGH THE THERMAL LABEL. UPON BOX INSPECTION REVEALED FOUR X 3.5 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE SPAZ STIX PREMIUM PAINTS SPRAY PAINT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report I-2024010030
item.description:
Report I-2024010030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-31T00:35:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: Ontario
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: H2 SERVICES LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1900000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the filling of the trailer, an end plug thermal pressure relief device(TPRD) had an unplanned activation. The TPRD vent manifold intended to safely route any venting gas appeared to be improperly assembled allowing high pressure hydrogen gas to escape through leaks in the vent manifold. The resulting leaks created ignited the hydrogen causing significant damage to the trailer and damage to the another trailer being filled along side the trailer that caught fire.

item.title: Report E-2024050683
item.description:
Report E-2024050683

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN1993 Sanifect D2 (AFCO 5503) release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 3’ x 2’ area of the wood trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged drum into a new 55- gallon metal drum. The damaged drum and impacted absorbents were then containerized into a second 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050684
item.description:
Report E-2024050684

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN1830 Sulfuric Acid release from 5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.55-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due loose caps on the jugs. The jugs were wiped down, caps were secured, and they were re-stacked and secure for shipment on. Sodium bicarbonate and oil dri were then deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024050070
item.description:
Report I-2024050070

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: FORT ERIE ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Standard Ground package from USA to Canada was inspected by customs to find invoice description of shampoo does not match package contents. Package was flagged for inspection and when opened revealed that the description was not accurate and there was camp fuel inside. There are no dangerous goods marks or labels on the outer box to indicate flammable camp fuel was inside the box. The package was shipped using UPS account WE5813, Comfylife Intl, 809 Hylton Rd, Pennsauken NJ 08110.
